pages.text: Practitioners of Witchcraft often possess a drove of unique devices used in many parts of witchery.

pages.title: Witches' Oven
pages.text: Likely the first machine the aspiring witch will obtain, the Witches' Oven can burn certain reagents down to special fumes, and can produce a range of secondary products. If a Witches' Oven is given Clay Jars, it will collect the produced fumes.

pages.title: Witches' Cauldron
pages.text: Used most commonly for creating advanced brews that mundane Brewing Stands simply can’t match. Certain other items can be boiled down and combined in the cauldron to create new ones. Cauldrons require magic energy and need a fire under them to work.

pages.title: Distillery
pages.text: Used to make higher-tier fumes than what the Witch’s Oven can produce alone. Certain other compounds can also be created with this device. The distillery requires magic energy and must use Blaze Powder as a fuel.

pages.title: Spinning Wheel
pages.text: Used to create magical threads and strings. Requires magic energy to function.

pages.title: Crystal Ball
pages.text: Crystal balls are rather magical in general. They are most commonly used to predict the future and give out fortunes, but some claim they can be used for other things, such as remote viewing. The witches who claim to be able to do this usually can't prove it…
